get.description: Fetch the portfolio of Advertisers for this account

201.description: The ad set that has been created and errors / warnings

get.description: Get the data for the specified ad set

put.description: Link or unlink an audience with an ad set

get.description: Get the list of self-services Creatives for a given advertiser

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of creatives to be returned. The default is 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The (zero-based) offset into the collection of creatives. The default is 0.

200.description: The list of self-services Creatives is returned.

post.description: Creates all segments with a valid configuration, and returns their IDs. For those that cannot be created, one or multiple errors are returned.

get.description: Returns a list with all available in-market brands that can be used to define an in-market segment.
Returns a list with all available in-market interests that can be used to define an in-market segment. These in-market interests correspond to the Google product taxonomy.

post.description: Creates all audiences with a valid configuration, and returns their IDs. For those that cannot be created, one or multiple errors are returned.
Returns a list of audiences that match the provided filters. If present, the filters are AND'ed together when applied.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of elements to be returned. The default is 50 and the maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The (zero-based) offset into the collection. The default is 0.

201.description: The campaign that has been created and errors / warnings

get.description: Get the data for the specified campaign
Get information about the currently logged application

post.description: Retrieves a list of products recommended for the given user. This end point can either rely on a Criteo UserId, or a list of user events to perform the recommendation.

The Statistics API allows measurement and reporting on campaigns using the metrics and dimensions you specify.
# Query

## AdvertiserIds

If you do not specify any value for advertiserIds, stats for all advertisers in your portfolio will be returned.
Be worry of requesting too much data.

## Metrics
Metrics are created with a common structure, such as: SalesAllPc30d
The naming follows the following pattern: `[Measurement][Devices][AttributionModel][LookbackWindow]`

### A Note about Audience and Reach with the Category Dimension
The algorithm used for merging audience count across categories is non-commutative (by design).
It is expected that Audience and Reach metrics produce slightly different results when queried with and without the category dimension.

adSetId.description: The id of the Ad Set binded to this Ad

creativeId.description: The id of the Creative binded to this Ad

endDate.description:
The date when when we will stop to show this ad. If the end date is not specified (i.e. null) then the ad will go on forever
String must be in ISO8601 format

id.description: Unique identifier (duplicate of the parent id).

inventoryType.description: The inventory the Ad belongs to. Possible values are "Display" and "Native". This is optional since this doesn't make sense for every creative type but will throw an error if not set for a dynamic creative.

startDate.description:
The date when the ad will be launched
String must be in ISO8601 format

Ad.description: An ad is the binding that connects a creative with an ad set

callsToAction.description:
A Call-to-Action (CTA) is an action-driven instruction to your audience intended to provoke an immediate
response, such as “Buy now” or “Go!”.

space ("ShowFullImage") or whether it should fill that space ("ZoomOnImage"). If you choose ZoomOnImage, there may be some
image cropping.

Warnings list returned by the Criteo API
In some situations the operations are successful but it may be useful to issue warnings to the API consumer.
